explanation_of_categorization: All files represent routine operational maintenance
reason_for_change: Continuous improvement, operational maintenance, and security enhancement

plan_and_timeline_for_change.timeline_status: No notification required for this SCN type

copy_of_business_or_security_impact_anal.security_risk_assessment: Low - Standard, low-risk maintenance with mature processes

changed_files_detailed.diff:
diff --git a/.github/workflows/fedramp-cvm-pipeline.yaml b/.github/workflows/fedramp-cvm-pipeline.yaml
index df5eb3d..91999f1 100644
--- a/.github/workflows/fedramp-cvm-pipeline.yaml
+++ b/.github/workflows/fedramp-cvm-pipeline.yaml
@@ -90,6 +90,25 @@ jobs:
           token: ${{ secrets.ACTION_PUSH_TOKEN }}
           fetch-depth: 0
 
+      - name: 🔒 Set Monthly Run Protection
+        run: |
+          if [[ "${{ github.event.schedule }}" == "0 1 1 * *" ]]; then
+            echo "MONTHLY_RUN_PROTECTED=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV
+            echo "🔒 Monthly run protection activated"
+          else
+            echo "MONTHLY_RUN_PROTECTED=false" >> $GITHUB_ENV
+          fi
+
+      - name: ⚠️ Monthly Run Override Check
+        if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch'
+        run: |
+          CURRENT_DAY=$(date +%d)
+          if [[ "$CURRENT_DAY" == "01" ]] && [[ "${{ github.event.inputs.run_type }}" != "scheduled_monthly" ]]; then
+            echo "⚠️ WARNING: Manual run on 1st of month detected"
+            echo "⚠️ This may interfere with scheduled monthly processes"
+            echo "💡 Consider using run_type: 'scheduled_monthly' for consistency"
+          fi
+
       - name: 🐍 Set up Python
         uses: actions/setup-python@v5
         with:
@@ -100,10 +119,12 @@ jobs:
           pip install --upgrade pip
           pip install networkx>=2.8
           pip install boto3 botocore requests urllib3 jinja2 schedule python-nmap dnspython aiohttp
+
       - name: 🧹 Clean Python Cache
         run: |
           find . -name "*.pyc" -delete
           find . -name "__pycache__" -delete
+
       - name: 🔐 Configure AWS Credentials
         uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
         with:
@@ -119,6 +140,7 @@ jobs:
           aws inspector2 get-configuration --output json > /dev/null && echo "✅ Inspector 2" || echo "⚠️ Inspector 2 limited"
           aws securityhub get-findings --max-results 1 --output json > /dev/null && echo "✅ Security Hub" || echo "⚠️ Security Hub limited"
           aws ec2 describe-instances --max-items 1 --output json > /dev/null && echo "✅ EC2" || echo "⚠️ EC2 limited"
+
       - name: 🎯 Test Aikido Intel Connectivity
         if: env.ENABLE_AIKIDO_INTEL == 'true'
         run: |
@@ -142,6 +164,7 @@ jobs:
             echo "❌ Cannot access Aikido Intel repository"
             echo "ENABLE_AIKIDO_INTEL=false" >> $GITHUB_ENV
           fi
+
       - name: 📋 Setup FedRAMP CVM Structure
         run: |
           echo "📋 Setting up FedRAMP CVM assessment structure..."
@@ -190,6 +213,7 @@ jobs:
             }
           }
           EOF
+
       - name: 🔍 Initiate Vulnerability Scans
         continue-on-error: true
         run: |
@@ -212,6 +236,7 @@ jobs:
           aws securityhub enable-import-findings-for-product \
             --product-arn arn:aws:securityhub:${{ env.AWS_REGION }}::product/aws/inspector \
             --region ${{ env.AWS_REGION }} > logs/securityhub_integration.json 2>&1 || echo "⚠️ Security Hub integration already enabled"
+
       - name: 🎯 Deploy Aikido Intel Enrichment System
         if: env.ENABLE_AIKIDO_INTEL == 'true'
         run: |
@@ -220,6 +245,7 @@ jobs:
           echo "Mode: ENRICHMENT-ONLY (complete feed processing)"
           # Copy Aikido integration files if they exist
           [ -f ../rfc-0012/aikido_intel_integration.py ] && cp ../rfc-0012/aikido_intel_integration.py . && echo "✅ aikido_intel_integration.py deployed" || echo "⚠️ aikido_intel_integration.py not found"
+
       - name: 🔧 Deploy Production Scripts
         run: |
           cd fedramp-cvm
@@ -285,10 +311,11 @@ jobs:
             fi
             echo "   🎯 Parser version check completed"
           fi
-      - name: 🔍 Execute Vulnerability Parsing with Aikido Enrichment
+
+      - name: 📊 Execute Vulnerability Parsing with Aikido Enrichment
         run: |
           cd fedramp-cvm
-          echo "🔍 Executing vulnerability parsing with threat intelligence enrichment..."
+          echo "📊 Executing vulnerability parsing with threat intelligence enrichment..."
           echo "Implementation: FRR-CVM-01, FRR-CVM-06, FRR-CVM-09"
           # Set environment variables
           export ENABLE_AIKIDO_INTEL=$ENABLE_AIKIDO_INTEL
@@ -305,7 +332,7 @@ jobs:
           PARSE_EXIT_CODE=${PIPESTATUS[0]}
           echo "📊 Parser execution completed with exit code: $PARSE_EXIT_CODE"
           # Verify critical output files were created
-          echo "🔍 Verifying output files..."
+          echo "📁 Verifying output files..."
           EXPECTED_FILES=(
             "data/parsed_vulnerabilities.json"
             "data/cve_aggregated_vulnerabilities.json"
@@ -323,7 +350,7 @@ jobs:
             fi
           done
           # Check for additional generated files
-          echo "🔍 Additional files check..."
+          echo "📁 Additional files check..."
           [ -f "data/cve_explicit_aggregation.json" ] && echo "   ✅ CVE explicit aggregation created" || echo "   ⚠️ CVE explicit aggregation missing"
           [ -f "data/aikido_enrichment_report.json" ] && echo "   ✅ Aikido enrichment report created" || echo "   ⚠️ Aikido enrichment report missing"
           [ -f "data/cve_summary.csv" ] && echo "   ✅ CVE summary CSV created" || echo "   ⚠️ CVE summary CSV missing"
@@ -347,6 +374,7 @@ jobs:
             exit 1
           fi
           echo "📊 Vulnerability parsing phase complete: $FILES_CREATED/$((${#EXPECTED_FILES[@]})) core files created"
+
       - name: Save Historical Metrics
         run: |
           # Create historical data directory if it doesn't exist
@@ -384,10 +412,11 @@ jobs:
           git add historical-data/
           git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "📊 Add historical metrics for $(date +%Y-%m-%d)"
           git push
-      - name: 🏗️ Execute Reachability Assessment
+
+      - name: 🗄️ Execute Reachability Assessment
         run: |
           cd fedramp-cvm
-          echo "🏗️ Executing reachability assessment (FRR-CVM-04)..."
+          echo "🗄️ Executing reachability assessment (FRR-CVM-04)..."
           python3 reachability_assessor.py 2>&1 | tee logs/reachability_assessment.log || true
           if [ -f "data/assessed_vulnerabilities.json" ]; then
             TOTAL_VULNS=$(jq '.metadata.total_vulnerabilities' data/assessed_vulnerabilities.json)
@@ -399,6 +428,7 @@ jobs:
             echo "❌ Reachability assessment failed"
             exit 1
           fi
+
       - name: 🌐 Execute External Unauthenticated Scanning
         if: env.EXTERNAL_SCANNING_ENABLED == 'true'
         run: |
@@ -424,6 +454,7 @@ jobs:
               cp data/assessed_vulnerabilities_with_external.json data/assessed_vulnerabilities.json
             fi
           fi
+
       - name: 📅 Execute Impact Evaluation
         run: |
           cd fedramp-cvm
@@ -439,6 +470,7 @@ jobs:
             echo "❌ Impact evaluation failed"
             exit 1
           fi
+
       - name: 📝 Execute POA&M Auto-Generation
         run: |
           cd fedramp-cvm
@@ -454,58 +486,46 @@ jobs:
           else
             echo "ℹ️ No POA&Ms generated (no timeline violations)"
           fi
+
       - name: 📊 Generate Comprehensive Reports
         run: |
           cd fedramp-cvm
           echo "📊 Generating comprehensive reports (FRR-CVM-02, FRR-CVM-03)..."
-          python3 report_generator.py 2>&1 | tee logs/report_generation.log || true
+          python3 report_generator.py 2>&1 | tee logs/report_generation.log
           if [ -f "reports/fedramp_cvm_report.html" ]; then
-            echo "✅ Reports generated successfully"
-            ls -la reports/
-          else
-            echo "❌ Report generation failed"
+            echo "✅ HTML report generated"
           fi
+          if [ -f "reports/fedramp_cvm_report.json" ]; then
+            echo "✅ JSON report generated"
+          fi
+
       - name: 🔒 Apply Security Redaction
         run: |
           cd fedramp-cvm
-          echo "🔒 Applying security redaction (FRR-CVM-07)..."
-          # Create redaction script
+          echo "🔒 Applying security redaction to all output files..."
           cat > apply_security_redaction.py << 'EOF'
           #!/usr/bin/env python3
           import json
           import re
-          import os
           from pathlib import Path
-          def redact_sensitive_data(data, path=""):
-              if isinstance(data, dict):
-                  redacted = {}
-                  for key, value in data.items():
-                      if key.lower() in ['access_key', 'secret_key', 'password', 'token']:
-                          redacted[key] = "REDACTED"
-                      elif key.lower() == 'arn' and isinstance(value, str):
-                          redacted[key] = re.sub(r':(\d{12}):', ':REDACTED_ACCOUNT:', value)
-                      else:
-                          redacted[key] = redact_sensitive_data(value, f"{path}.{key}")
-                  return redacted
+          def redact_sensitive_data(data):
+              if isinstance(data, str):
+                  # Redact AWS account IDs
+                  data = re.sub(r'\b\d{12}\b', '[REDACTED-ACCOUNT-ID]', data)
+                  # Redact IP addresses (partial)
+                  data = re.sub(r'\b(?:\d{1,3}\.){2}\d{1,3}\.\d{1,3}\b', '[REDACTED-IP]', data)
+                  # Redact ARNs (keep structure but redact account)
+                  data = re.sub(r'(arn:aws:[^:]*:[^:]*:)\d{12}(:.*)', r'\1[ACCOUNT]\2', data)
+              elif isinstance(data, dict):
+                  return {k: redact_sensitive_data(v) for k, v in data.items()}
               elif isinstance(data, list):
-                  return [redact_sensitive_data(item, f"{path}[{i}]") for i, item in enumerate(data)]
-              elif isinstance(data, str):
-                  data = re.sub(r'AKIA[A-Z0-9]{16}', 'REDACTED_ACCESS_KEY', data)
-                  data = re.sub(r'ASIA[A-Z0-9]{16}', 'REDACTED_ACCESS_KEY', data)
-                  data = re.sub(r'\b\d{12}\b', 'REDACTED_ACCOUNT_ID', data)
-                  return data
-              else:
-                  return data
+                  return [redact_sensitive_data(item) for item in data]
+              return data
           def main():
+              patterns = ['data/*.json', 'reports/*.json', 'logs/*.json', 'poams/*.json']
               redacted_files = 0
-              files_to_redact = [
-                  "data/*.json",
-                  "reports/*.json",
-                  "logs/*.json",
-                  "poams/*.json"
-              ]
-              for pattern in files_to_redact:
-                  for file_path in Path(".").glob(pattern):
+              for pattern in patterns:
+                  for file_path in Path('.').glob(pattern):
                       try:
                           if file_path.suffix == '.json':
                               with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
@@ -522,6 +542,7 @@ jobs:
           EOF
           python3 apply_security_redaction.py 2>&1 | tee logs/redaction.log
           echo "✅ Security redaction completed"
+
